name: Customized Vectras VM Image
summary: Learn about .CVBI files and view a list of programs that open them.

windows.name: Open over 400 file formats with File Viewer Plus.Free Download

content: Advanced users, developers, or hobbyists who want to run full Linux-based systems or other operating environments within Android are the primary users of Vectras VM. They often use the software for testing, learning, or software development without needing a separate physical computer.

The CVBI format bundles all the components needed to run a complete operating system, such as a preinstalled Linux or Windows environment, within Vectras VM. This portable virtual machine package streamlines the process for users by eliminating the need to configure complex virtualization settings manually.
NOTE: The Vectras VM VBI format is similar to the .VBI format, but it is a customized version. It includes the base VM image (VBI) along with additional configuration.

description: A CVBI file is a customized virtual machine (VM) image used by Vectras VM, an Android app that allows users to run virtual machines on mobile devices. It stores a preconfigured virtual machine, which may include an operating system, applications, and file system data. Vectras VM reads the contents of a CVBI file to set up and launch a virtual environment on an Android device.

instructions: You can open CVBI files with Vectras VM through its built-in ROM Manager, which handles virtual machine setup and configuration. When you select Import a CVBI File and choose a CVBI file, the app automatically applies default parameters to create a virtual machine instance from the file.
